home.title: Welcome to the Eurovision 2026 in Vienna!
home.subtitle: Get ready for one of Europe’s most spectacular music events – in the vibrant capital of Austria. Stay informed and start planning your trip.
section.expect.title: What to expect
section.expect.text: Although exact dates and the venue are still pending, fans can look forward to an exciting Eurovision season in spring 2026 in Vienna.
section.stay.title: Plan your stay
section.stay.text: Book your hotel early to secure the best deals:
section.explore.title: Discover Vienna
section.explore.text1: Discover imperial architecture, cozy coffee houses, and a vibrant nightlife during your stay.
section.explore.text2: Want to experience Vienna like a local? Discover tours and activities:
section.tickets.title: How do I get tickets for the ESC 2026 in Austria?
section.tickets.text: Ticket sales for the ESC 2026 are expected to start at the beginning of 2026 – as soon as the venue has been officially confirmed. Official tickets will only be available through authorized platforms such as oeticket.com. Beware of scam sites!
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions about the Eurovision Song Contest
faq.q1: When does the ESC 2026 take place?
faq.a1: The exact dates are not yet determined, but traditionally the semi-finals and the final take place in May.
faq.q2: Where will the ESC 2026 be held?
faq.a2: Several cities are bidding, including Vienna, Innsbruck, and Graz. The final venue is expected to be announced in 2025.
faq.a3: Tickets will be sold exclusively through authorized platforms like oeticket.com. Beware of unofficial vendors.
faq.a4: That has not yet been decided. The ORF will present the Austrian act at a later stage.
faq.q5: Will the ESC 2026 be broadcast on TV?
faq.a5: Yes, the ORF and other European broadcasters will broadcast the competition live as usual.

footer.notice2: All content is original and does not use any copyrighted material from the show.

impressum.notice: This website is a privately operated fan site and is not connected to the EBU or the official organizers of the Eurovision Song Contest. All content was created independently and does not use any copyrighted material.
esc2026_summary:
The Eurovision Song Contest 2026 will take place in Austria! After the great victory of JJ with his hit "Wasted Love" at the ESC 2025 in Basel, Austria will host for the third time – following the shows in 1967 and 2015.

Preparations are now in full swing, as several Austrian cities want to host the legendary music competition.

  • Vienna: The capital, which already proved in 2015 how to rock such a major event.
  • Innsbruck: Joining the mix – with the famous Olympic Hall as a possible venue.
  • Wels: Competing with a new, modern hall that is expected to be completed by March 2026 just for the ESC.
  • Graz: Also taking a close look at the city hall.
  • Oberwart: Shows great interest – even if challenges such as lack of accommodation exist.

Other cities like Salzburg and Klagenfurt have already withdrawn their applications, either because they do not have suitable locations or the costs would be too high.

The ORF and the Austrian government will decide in the coming months exactly where the spectacle will take place.

One thing is clear: The ESC 2026 will again captivate music fans with two exciting semi-finals and a grand finale.

Look forward to an unforgettable show in Austria – it's going to be a real highlight!
